'''Ballads of Breeze''' is a part of the [[Windblume's Breath]] event in [[Version 3.5]]. Complete ''[[Ballads of Breeze (Windblume's Breath)|Ballads of Breeze]]'' to unlock this event segment.

==Tutorial==
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Windblumes Ballads of Breeze 1.png
|text1  = During the performance, different notes will appear on the screen. When a note falls on the Decision Line, strike the Decision Line to score points. The amount of points scored will vary depending on the timing of your stroke.
|image2 = Tutorial Windblumes Ballads of Breeze 2.png
|text2  = A long note is represented by a long strip of light. Hold until the light strip disappears, then release in time to score points.
}}
;Adding Notes
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Windblumes Ballads of Breeze Adding Notes 1.png
|text1  = In Normal Editing Mode, click on the input button to add notes at the current moment. Hold the input button during music playback to add a long note.
|image2 = Tutorial Windblumes Ballads of Breeze Adding Notes 2.png
|text2  = In Advanced Editing Mode, you can select the type of note to add, and that note will be added to the closest available time scale line. Selecting the beginning and ending notes of a long note will automatically create a long note.
}}
;Timing
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Windblumes Ballads of Breeze Timing 1.png
|text1  = The timeline shows the progress of the current music playback and will automatically move forward as the music plays. At the same time, current edits will also be marked on the timeline.
}}
;Rhythm Line
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial The Almighty Arataki Great and Glorious Drumalong Festival 6.png<!-- same image as in the drumalong event -->
|text1  = The Rhythm Line is the rhythm point position recommended by the system and will fall while the music is playing. When adding notes, the notes are preferentially attached to the Rhythm Line.
}}
;Edit and Trial
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Windblumes Ballads of Breeze Edit and Trial 1.png
|text1  = The Rhythm Line is the rhythm point position recommended by the system and will fall while the music is playing. When adding notes, the notes are preferentially attached to the Rhythm Line.
}}
;Import Function Tutorial
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Windblumes Ballads of Breeze Import 1.png
|text1  = In Editing Mode, you can import pre-existing music scores. Official stages and personally-saved records can all be used as templates for importing.
}}
;Save Function Tutorial
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Windblumes Ballads of Breeze Save 1.png
|text1  = Players can save archive copies of any song, and will have up to 50 save slots. If the archive from which the sharing code was generated has been overwritten, the player must perform that song once more before its modified contents may be played by anyone else.
}}
;Sharing Function Tutorial
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial The Almighty Arataki Great and Glorious Drumalong Festival 10.png<!-- same image as in the drumalong event -->
|text1  = Players can archive scores that they have saved and generate sharing codes from them to allow others to play them, provided that they themselves are able to reach a specific rank in playing that tune.
}}

==Songs==
* The songs do not need to be completed in successive order.
* For rewards, a score of at least Dulcem rating is required for each difficulty.
